sentences.en: Actors have the reputation of being highly temperamental.
sentences.cn: 演员的性情变幻无常是众所周知的.

sentences.en: He has a temperamental dislike for hard work.
sentences.cn: 他本质上不喜欢辛苦的工作.

sentences.en: He has a temperamental dislike of sports.
He is very temperamental and critical.
sentences.cn: 他好使性子，还爱挑毛病。

sentences.en: He was seen as truculent, temperamental, too unwilling to tolerate others.
sentences.cn: 他们认为他为人蛮横无理, 性情暴躁, 不大能容人.

sentences.en: He's avery temperamental player, ie plays well or badly accordingto his mood.
sentences.cn: 他是个情绪波动的演员(演得好坏由心情而定).

sentences.en: I first started cruising in yachts with temperamental petrol engines.
sentences.cn: 我刚开始驾驶游艇航行时，艇上的汽油发动机老出毛病。

sentences.en: I was a temperamental genius in need of reining in by stabler personalities.
sentences.cn: 我是个需要由更稳重的人降服住的神经质的天才.

sentences.en: Nigel is temperamental but he's very highly strung, you know.
sentences.cn: 奈杰变化无常,但你知道他是很容易激动的.

sentences.en: Plato, Locke, Hegel, Spencer, are such temperamental thinkers.
sentences.cn: 柏拉图 、 洛克 、 黑格尔 、 斯宾塞是这种有特殊气质的思想家.

sentences.en: Preston is particularly good at handling temperamental people.
sentences.cn: 普雷斯顿特别擅长对付喜怒无常的人。

sentences.en: Some programs set this limit too close, resulting in frustratingly temperamental scroll behavior.
sentences.cn: 一些程序将这种限制设置得太窄, 导致滚屏的行为变幻无常,令人沮丧.

sentences.en: The actress was so temperamental that many people refused to work with her.
sentences.cn: 那位女演员喜怒无常,许多人都拒绝和她合作.

sentences.en: There are physical and temperamental differences.
sentences.cn: 存在着生理和气质上的差异.
维克斯机枪有时会出故障。

sentences.en: You never know what to expect with her. She's so temperamental.
sentences.cn: 你永远说不清她要干什么。她一时一变。

words.tran_cn: 脾气；（钢等）回火；性情；倾向
使回火；锻炼；调和；使缓和

trans.tran_cn: 气质的，性格的，不可靠的，<口>喜怒无常的
trans.tran_en: likely to suddenly become upset, excited, or angry – used to show disapproval
